description.text: this message file contains message for [name] package

msg.text: The design contains DDR memory component that is not available in the targeted device package '$$s'.
For DELAYD component '$$s', the input DEL$$d is floating. Connecting input to GND.\n
The output of PLLREFCS component '$$s' should drive the CLKI pin of single instance of PLL component.
Dynamic Delay '$$s' is not supported for IREG '$$s'. Use Static Delay instead.\n
Dynamic Delay '$$s' is not supported for IDDRX1 '$$s'. Use Static Delay or use IDDRX2 or IDDRX4 modes instead.\n
Dynamic Delay '$$s' is not supported for IDDRDQSX1A component '$$s'.\n
Dynamic delay component '$$s' cannot be connected as driver of $$s pin of IDDR '$$s'. Drive needed to input data pin.
Dynamic delay component '$$s' cannot drive component '$$s'.\n
Static delay component '$$s' cannot be connected as driver of $$s pin of register '$$s'. Drive needed to input data pin.
Static delay component '$$s' cannot be connected as driver of $$s pin of input DDR '$$s'. Drive needed to input data pin.
Static Delay '$$s' is not supported for IDDRDQSX1A component '$$s'.\n
Static delay component '$$s' cannot drive component '$$s'.\n
The LVDSOB component '$$s' output signal '$$s' can only drive a single output buffer. The signal cannot fanout to other logic.\n
The LVDSOB component '$$s' output signal '$$s' cannot drive component '$$s'. The LVDSOB component needs to drive an LVDS output buffer.
X2A : Attempting to program input register in IDDR. \n
X2A : Attempting to program output register in ODDR. \n
Error(s) in PIO control signal(s). Check your design.
$$s DDR '$$s' has incompatible $$s control with $$s DDR '$$s' of PIO '$$s'.
$$s DDR '$$s' has incompatible $$s control with $$s Register/Latch '$$s' of PIO '$$s'.
$$s DDR $$s is not uniquely connected to IO $$s.
Cannot pack generic DDRs '$$s' and '$$s' in the same external PIO/PIC (port: $$s, iobuf: $$s).
Cannot pack memory and generic DDRs '$$s' and '$$s' in the same external PIO/PIC (port: $$s, iobuf: $$s).
Input register $$s cannot be packed into DDR only PIC site.\n
Output register $$s cannot be packed into DDR only PIC site.\n
This device does not allow packing DDR and input register in same PIC component. Cannot pack register $$s in external PIO/PIC (port: $$s, iobuf: $$s). Converting into internal PFU register.
This device does not allow packing DDR and output register in same PIC component. Cannot pack register $$s in external PIO/PIC (port: $$s, iobuf: $$s). Converting into internal PFU register.
This device does not allow packing IDDR and tristate register in same PIC component. Cannot pack register $$s in external PIO/PIC (port: $$s, iobuf: $$s). Converting into internal PFU register.
Cannot pack register '$$s' as tristate register with DDR in external PIO/PIC (port: $$s, iobuf: $$s).
Register '$$s' cannot be used as tristate register with ODDRDQS '$$s'. Use a TDDRA component as tristate.
$$s Cannot pack register as tristate register with DDR in external PIO/PIC (port: $$s, iobuf: $$s). Converting into internal PFU register.
Unknown DDR type.\n
DDR component $$s cannot be packed in any I/O logic block.
The Dynamic Bank Controller BCLVDSO '$$s' is not driven by a signal connected to the LVDSENI port.
Invalid BANKID '$$d' on Dynamic Bank Controller BCLVDSO '$$s'. Using BANKID value of 0.
More than one instance of Dynamic Bank Controller BCLVDSO instantiated ($$s, $$s). Only one can be used.
Non-output IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component LVDSOB '$$s'. LVDSOB is applicable for LVDS output buffer and will be ignored.
IO component '$$s' of IO_TYPE $$s is combined with instantiated power saving component LVDSOB '$$s'. LVDSOB is not applicable for IO_TYPE $$s and will be ignored.
IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component LVDSOB '$$s' that has its control signal '$$s' tied to GND. LVDSOB is disabled in this case and will be ignored.
Output IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component LVDSOB '$$s' that has an invalid BANKID '$$d'. Using BANKID value of 0.
IO component '$$s' LVDS power saving usage is being attempted in 2 ways. One using instantiated LVDSOB '$$s', the other using bank controller BCLVDSO '$$s'. Use on of the ways to program the LVDS.
IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component LVDSOB '$$s' that is missing the control signal to port E.
IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component LVDSOB '$$s' with control signal '$$s' that causes conflict with bank controller '$$s' and its control signal '$$s'.
The Dynamic Bank Controller BCLVDSO '$$s' does not control any IOs. It will be removed.

ECLKSYNC component '$$s' used for DDR ECLK is driven by IO '$$s'. The IO to ECLKSYNC connectivity has to be routed through an ECLKBRIDGECS component. ECLKBRIDGECS cannot be used with GDDRX2/GDDRX4 RX DDR interfaces. ECLKBRIDGECS can only be used with GDDRX71 RX and all GDDRX2/4/71 TX DDR interfaces.
DQSDLLC component '$$s' cannot drive more than 5 DLLDELC components
The $$s component '$$s' has signal '$$s' on DQSI pin driven by a non-PIO component '$$s'. DQSI pin should be driven by a PIO component. \n
The $$s component '$$s' is driven by DQS pad '$$s' that is connected to multiple DQSBUF components. The DQS pad can drive only a single $$s component via the DQSI port. \n
Only 1 DQSDLL can be used for memory implementation in the device. The design has DQSDLL components '$$s' and '$$s' used for memory implementation.
The output pin DQSR90 of DQSBUF component '$$s' has incorrect connection to component '$$s' via signal '$$s'. The DQSR90 pin can only drive the DQSR90 pin of IDDRDQSX1A component.
The output pin DQSW90 of DQSBUF component '$$s' has incorrect connection to component '$$s' via signal '$$s'. The DQSW90 pin can only drive the DQSW90 pin of either ODDRDQSX1A or TDDRA components.
Cannot find component for ddrConnectivityCheckDriverOfPin.
Input pin $$s of DDR component $$s for port $$s is not properly connected.
Input pin $$s of DDR component $$s for port $$s is driven by component $$s($$s). Expect a $$s component to drive this pin.
Input pin $$s of DDR component $$s for port $$s is driven by pin $$s of component $$s($$s). Expect pin $$s to be the driver.
Input pin DDRCLKPOL of input DDR component '$$s' must use DDRCLKPOL from DQSBUFH component.
The input pin DQSR90 of IDDR component '$$s' must use DQSR90 from DQSBUFH component to implement 90 degree phase shift during DDR memory read.
The input pin DQSW90 of ODDR component '$$s' used for DM implementation must use DQSW90 from DQSBUFH component to implement 90 degree phase shift during DDR memory write.

The ODDR component '$$s' used for DM implementation has DQSW90 pin tied to SCLK. The DQSW90 pin must be connected to DQSW90 of DQSBUFH component to implement 90 degree phase shift during DDR memory write.
The input pin DQSW90 of ODDR component '$$s' used for DQ implementation must use DQSW90 from DQSBUFH component to implement 90 degree phase shift during DDR memory write.
The input pin DQSW90 of TDDR component '$$s' used for DQ implementation must use DQSW90 from DQSBUFH component to implement 90 degree phase shift during DDR memory write.
The ODDR component '$$s' used for DQS implementation must have the DQSW90 pin tied to SCLK to implement 0 degree phase shift during DQS implementation for memory write.

The TDDRA component '$$s' has the DQSW90_INVERT property ENABLED for DQS implementation. The DQSW90 pin must be tied to SCLK to implement 0 degree phase shift during DQS implementation for memory write.
The DQSW90_INVERT property of DQS TDDRA component '$$s' is not correctly set. The DQSW90_INVERT must be set to ENABLED.
The IDDR component '$$s' is part of GDDRX_RX.Aligned with PLL interface that has not been validated in the hardware. Use IPexpress to re-generate a compatible module.
$$s component '$$s' must have clock signal driving ECLK port.
$$s component '$$s' must have clock signal driving SCLK port.
$$s component '$$s' ECLK signal '$$s' must be driven by ECLKSYNC component output ECLKO port, otherwise ECLK/SCLK domain crossing cannot be guaranteed.
$$s component '$$s' SCLK signal '$$s' must be driven by CLKDIV component$$s output CDIVX port, otherwise ECLK/SCLK domain crossing cannot be guaranteed.
$$s component '$$s' ECLK signal '$$s' needs to drive both $$s ECLK and CLKDIV component$$sCLKI ports to guarantee bus synchronization.
$$s component '$$s' ALIGNWD signal '$$s' needs to drive both $$s ALIGNWD and CLKDIV component$$sALIGNWD ports to perform proper word alignment.
$$s component '$$s' has ECLKBRIDGECS in its ECLK path. Component ECLKBRIDGECS can only be used in GDDRX71_RX and all GDDRX2/4/71_TX interfaces.
Signal CLKI is missing in $$s '$$s'.\n
$$s '$$s' output clocks are missing.\n

The $$s component '$$s' clock input is connected to signal '$$s' that is driven by OSC component '$$s'. The OSC NOM_FREQ property value of '$$1.2f' has been converted to FREQUENCY preference on the OSC output (PLL clock input). The value of $$1.2fMHz is invalid PLL input frequency and needs to be a valid value of $$1.2f to $$1.2fMHz. Update NOM_FREQ of OSC to a compatible frequency value.
$$s '$$s' has invalid input frequency FIN value ($$1.2f MHz). Valid values of FIN are $$1.2f to $$1.2f MHz.

Input frequency for $$s component '$$s' not specified. The $$s component should have the input frequency defined by the FREQUENCY preference. Using the default of $$1.2f Mhz in the absence of specified value.\n
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKI divider setting. Valid values are (1,2,3,...,$$d).\n
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKFB divider setting. Valid values are (1,2,3,...,$$d).\n
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOP divider setting. Valid values are (1,2,3,...,$$d).\n
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS divider setting. Valid values are (1,2,3,...,$$d).\n
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS2 divider setting. Valid values are (1,2,3,...,$$d).\n
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS3 divider setting. Valid values are (1,2,3,...,$$d).\n
The CLKFB of $$s component '$$s' has feedback connection, but the FEEDBK_PATH property has a value of '$$s' that does not match connectivity.
The CLKFB of $$s component '$$s' has feedback connection, but the FEEDBK_PATH property has a value of '$$s' that indicates in internal feedback setting.
The CLKFB of $$s component '$$s' does not have feedback connection, but the FEEDBK_PATH property has a value of '$$s' that indicates user selected signal to be connected as feedback.
The $$s component '$$s' has a new signal '$$s' added as feedback from $$s port to CLKFB port based on FEEDBK_PATH property setting.
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOP output frequency value ($$1.3f MHz). Valid values are $$1.3f to $$1.3f MHz.
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS output frequency value ($$1.3f MHz). Valid values are $$1.3f to $$1.3f MHz.
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS2 output frequency value ($$1.3f MHz). Valid values are $$1.3f to $$1.3f MHz.
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS3 output frequency value ($$1.3f MHz). Valid values are $$1.3f to $$1.3f MHz.
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOP_CPHASE value $$d. Valid values are $$d to $$d.
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS_CPHASE value $$d. Valid values are $$d to $$d.
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS2_CPHASE value $$d. Valid values are $$d to $$d.
$$s '$$s' has invalid CLKOS3_CPHASE value $$d. Valid values are $$d to $$d.
$$s '$$s' has invalid LPF_RESISTOR value $$d. Valid values are $$d to $$d.
$$s '$$s' has invalid ICP_CURRENT value $$d. Valid values are $$d to $$d.
$$s '$$s' has invalid FRACN_DIV value $$d. Valid values are $$d to $$d.
The $$s component '$$s' has port(s) connected for phase related operation. The following port(s) also need to be connected for phase related operations: $$s.
The $$s component '$$s' has port(s) connected for power related operation. The following port(s) also need to be connected for power related operation: $$s.
The $$s component '$$s' has STDBY port connected to VCC. This will keep the PLL in standby mode. Connect STDBY port to either GND or signal.
The $$s component '$$s' has port(s) connected for wishbone related operation. The following port(s) also need to be connected for wishbone related operation: $$s.
The $$s component '$$s' has connection to EFB component, but the PLL_USE_WB property is DISABLED. The PLL to EFB connectivity bit will not be turned on.
The CLKFB of $$s component '$$s' has feedback connection from $$s which is bypassed.
The CLKFB of $$s component '$$s' has feedback connection from $$s which has its $$s bypassed.
The PLL component '$$s' has the $$s component '$$s' incorrectly connected in the feedback path. The $$s component should be driven by CLKOP of the PLL.\n

Incorrect feedback connection in PLL component '$$s' that drives the IDDR component '$$s' configured as GDDRX71 interface. The PLL FEEDBK_PATH property value should be set to USERCLOCK and the CLKFBBUFA component must be used in the PLL feedback from CLKOP to CLKFB.\n
$$s '$$s' output CLKOP with $$d degree phase shift should not be used as the feedback signal (FEEDBK_PATH = $$s).
$$s '$$s' output CLKOS with $$d degree phase shift should not be used as the feedback signal (FEEDBK_PATH = $$s).
$$s '$$s' output CLKOS2 with $$d degree phase shift should not be used as the feedback signal (FEEDBK_PATH = $$s).
$$s '$$s' output CLKOS3 with $$d degree phase shift should not be used as the feedback signal (FEEDBK_PATH = $$s).
$$s '$$s' cannot obtain FREQUENCY_PIN_$$s=$$1.3f when FREQUENCY_PIN_CLKI=$$1.3f, CLKI_DIV=$$d, CLKFB_DIV=$$d, $$s_DIV=$$d.
